docs.snippet: President Barack Obama said on Tuesday that Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's comments on a 2005 videotape about groping women would disqualify him from even a job at a convenience store....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama said on Tuesday that Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump's comments on a 2005 videotape about groping women would disqualify him from even a job at a convenience store.

headline.main: Obama Says Trump's Comments on Women Disqualifying
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Trump's Comments on Women Disqualifying

docs.snippet: THE ISSUE: Energy independence has been a goal of every president since Richard Nixon. Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump have very different ways to achieve it. How energy is produced and where it comes from affect jobs, the economy and the environ...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE ISSUE: Energy independence has been a goal of every president since Richard Nixon. Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump have very different ways to achieve it. How energy is produced and where it comes from affect jobs, the economy and the environment.

docs.snippet: In reaching out to black voters, Donald Trump talks about bringing "law and order" to the "inner city."...
docs.lead_paragraph: In reaching out to black voters, Donald Trump talks about bringing "law and order" to the "inner city."

headline.main: Some Black Voters See Trump's Appeal to Blacks as Demeaning
headline.print_headline: Some Black Voters See Trump's Appeal to Blacks as Demeaning

docs.snippet: This weeknight newscast bills itself as atypical. But its segments, while competent, offer the usual fare....
docs.lead_paragraph: This weeknight newscast bills itself as atypical. But its segments, while competent, offer the usual fare.
docs.abstract: Mike Hale reviews premiere episode of Vice Media's weekly newscast Vice news Tonight, airing on HBO.

headline.main: Review: ‘Vice News Tonight,’ on HBO, Is New but No Game Changer
headline.print_headline: Sameness in a New News Show

docs.snippet: Florida residents were given six extra days to register to vote in the Nov. 8 election by a U.S. judge on Wednesday following the disruption triggered by powerful Hurricane Matthew in the state last week....
docs.lead_paragraph: Florida residents were given six extra days to register to vote in the Nov. 8 election by a U.S. judge on Wednesday following the disruption triggered by powerful Hurricane Matthew in the state last week.

headline.main: Judge Gives Florida Voters More Time to Register After Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Judge Gives Florida Voters More Time to Register After Hurricane
